title: Mauricio Pochettino's inner steel has driven Tottenham back into title race - they are now the team to watch
text:
Alli is mobbed after scoring (Photo: Chelsea Football Club) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Mauricio Pochettino turned away from the pitch and did a simple fist pump. 
It was an understated goal celebration after Dele Alli headed Tottenham in front while the majority of White Hart Lane was going crazy. 
Pochettino got a little bit more worked up on Alli’s second goal but he still shows a lot less emotion on the touchline than his opposite number Antonio Conte. 
There are fewer histrionics but just as much passion. Pochettino also has an inner steel, a single-minded determination which is driving Tottenham and has lifted them back into the title race. 
Pochettino went three at the back, he is bold enough to change his style for particular matches and his tactics outwitted Conte and ultimately defeated Chelsea. Antonio Conte and Mauricio Pochettino share a joke before the match (Photo: Reuters) The two bosses bark out instructions (Photo: Julian Finney) 
The rest of the Premier League now owe Pochettino a favour for keeping the title race but it is Tottenham who are undoubtedly the team to watch. 
Five straight wins, Tottenham are up to third and the momentum is with them thanks to Alli’s remarkable form. 
It is now six goals in four games for Alli and it is little wonder the likes of Real Madrid and Paris Saint Germain have taken notice. Tottenham's Dele Alli scores their first goal (Photo: Reuters) Dele Alli celebrates (Photo: Reuters) 
Alli is the player who gives Tottenham their X Factor, something different and his runs from midfield are a huge threat. 
His connection with Harry Kane - the pair of them have a telepathic understanding - is brilliant because they know exactly where to look for one another. 
It was Christian Eriksen who provided both crosses for Alli’s headed goals, the Tottenham midfielder using his strength and power to out jump the Chelsea defence. Alli adds his second (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur FC/Getty Images) Alli celebrates his goal (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur FC/Getty Images) 
His second goal after 54 minutes lifted the roof off White Hart Lane because that was the moment the home crowd really believed they were going to end Chelsea’s winning run. 
You need these sort of big results to give a team belief for the long term. And now they have it because Pochettino’s team is maturing fast and growing. 
The club’s new stadium is taking shape all around the old one. On the pitch the development is going just as quickly. And Pochettino is overseeing it all. poll loading Will Spurs finish in the top four this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
